title: The weather outside is...
body:
BEAUTIFUL!

Thank you Missouri weather for dishing out some of 2004's coldest days last week so you could save this week, the week we move, for wonderfully mild days that peak between 50 and 60 degrees. It doesn't get any better than that!
author: Dan

comments.author: Dave
comments.body: it rained so hard in philly last week that it was raining sideways! it was nuts.

comments.author: einahpets
comments.body: And I flew into Detroit with snow all over and 20 degrees. Ahhhh, the north.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body:
Good luck with the move. Hope it all goes well.

Oh, and Happy New Year to everyone!

comments.author: Oz
comments.body: I was in Missouri (Kansas City) from 12/25 - 12/29.  The weather was quite nice.  The day we left, it was supposed to get up to 66!

comments.author: Tim
comments.body: Damn, homeboy, quite a flurry of activity. And I refer not to the frozen "Flurry" confection offered at upscale McDonald's locations across this sexy nation. No, no. I refer instead to a real flurry. Well, not a flurry of snow, like unto the light sprinkling one gets in the winter. Nay again, I refer to a flurry which means: A sudden burst or commotion; a stir: a flurry of interest in the new product; a flurry of activity when the plane landed. And it sounds pretty good. You gon' kick the arthouse ass of that other theater. To quote that dead cajun chef Jeremy _________, "I guarONtee it." Keep up the good work. And try not to dwell on the strange fact that this note is longer than the blog entry to which it is attached. Peace and Happy New Year my friend!
